points: Leading a new machine learning project that takes in live visual data from a camera and classifies objects in real-time.
Built the Boring Club's website using HTML and JavaScript, resulting in a functional online presence entirely self-taught through online resources.
Secured the website and Raspberry Pi server using Cloudflare, improving the club's cybersecurity and uptime.
Used Verilog to develop an FPGA-based Traffic Light Simulator, gaining hands-on experience with digital design and hardware fundamentals.

roles.organization: Magnetorquers Lead in Attitude Determination and Control Systems Subsystem (ADCS)
points: Developing control systems by applying quaternion mathematics and linear algebra to fuse data from IMUs and magnetometers for precise magnetorquer coil actuation.
Designing PCB firmware for 3U-satellite magnetorquers, including H-bridge current control and circuit design.
Organize and lead weekly meetings with Magnetorquers Subsystem to discuss expectations and delegate work.
Created CAD designs of potentially in-house built cold gas propulsion systems for review and selection.
Researched extensively on passive heating systems to ensure HuskySat-2 maintains optimal temperature conditions.
Ran calculations using MATLAB to justify feasibility and effectiveness of passive heating louvers.
Batman's Kitchen at the University of Washington is a club that participates in CTFs and CCDC, as well as other competitons to sharpen cyber security skills.
Competed in the 2025 NeuroHackathon hosted by CoNECT, Synaptech, and the Allen Institute and ran a scientific study detecting changes in EEG signals from an OpenBCI headset based on scares.
Participated in weekly meetings to explore neurotechnology through hands-on projects and collaborative learning.
Participate in weekly tennis practices and matches, enhancing my skills and fostering teamwork.
Engage in social events and tournaments, building a sense of community within the club.

Managed club finances and oversaw all monetary transactions, including purchasing equipment (telescopes, tripods), merchandise (jackets, shirts), and handling event logistics (registration fees, craft materials, food).
Coordinated and led multiple full-day outreach events with up to 100 attendees, teaching K-12 students from diverse backgrounds about astronomy and promoting hands-on STEM learning.
Trained rigorously in tennis, balancing academics and athletics to achieve personal bests in both areas.
Competed the National School Games A Division Girls Tennis, obtaining Gold and Silver in 2022 and 2023 respectively.

sections.heading: Description
sections.content: I volunteer weekly at the Meet-The-People Sessions to attend to residents' needs and write letters to the various governmental or private agencies. Also involved in training new volunteers and familiarising them with the processes.

sections.heading: Description
sections.content: Volunteered for various events and projects as part of the Youth Corps Community Internship programme. Events include Art-Kid-Tech with YCDT-Shine, Intergen Evening Escapades with NTUC Health Nursing Home and Hearts Connect with Society of the Aged Sick etc.

sections.heading: Description
sections.content: Volunteered frequently for large-scaled events with Keat Hong Youth Network such as the Halloween Fiesta, Migrant Workers' carnival, Children's Art events and YouthWAVE PassionArts 2023 etc.

sections.heading: Role
points: Played important roles in ensuring the smooth running of events
Managed and assigned roles for volunteers, ensuring that manpower and resources were well accounted for
Planned and organised a Haunted House, leading a team of over 20 volunteers, and received over 4000 resident attendees

community.title: Leader and Founding Member of Project Binary

sections.heading: Description
sections.content: Project Binary is a group of students from Hwa Chong Institution working with CDAC to teach Python to Primary 4 and 5 students from less-privileged backgrounds.

sections.heading: Role
points: Directed all sessions efficiently and taught students in a fun and interactive method on Zoom
Distributed the workload among the team evenly and prepared all lesson materials from scratch

sections.heading: Description
sections.content: Project Tie-ger aims to teach basic guitar lessons and interact with children at Ang Mo Kio Family Service Centre (AMKFSC) during the June School Holidays.

sections.heading: Role
points: Planned and prepared lesson materials and guitar scores before each session
Organised and tabulated volunteer attendance and hours post-event

community.title: Organising Team Member of Project Grace

sections.heading: Description
sections.content: Project Grace is a team of youths from Hwa Chong Institution and Nanyang Girls' High School collaborating with Special Olympics Singapore to empower Athletes with Intellectual Disabilities.

sections.heading: Role
points: Organised and led online weekly fitness sessions with athletes during the COVID-19 pandemic
Facilitated an online seminar featuring Mr Sean Bai, Director General of the Valencia CF Academy and SOSG, raising awareness and over S$600 in funds
